<@U03UMPD2NNS>: Hi, I want to report a new issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `iadvize is blocking the page, because of a script`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Priority:* `High priority ðŸ”´`
*Description:* `Yesterday we were informed that once iadvize button is clicked the whole page freezes and the user cannot proceed. In their investigation they found that it is likely caused by a script running on our side. For now they turned off the chat function.

(more info in the thread)`
*Expected behaviour:* `iadvize not impacting proceeding further in the funnel`
*Actual behaviour:* `Temporairly chat is disabled, but before this happened user who clicks on chat had their whole page frozen. `

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-issue

Either way we can't rly debug this since now the chatbot is turned off

_thread_replies.text: data layer looks like this, I suspect some infinite loop getting triggered

elements.text: data layer looks like this, I suspect some infinite loop getting triggered

_thread_replies.text: those events are looping over and over, blocking the main javascript thread

elements.text: those events are looping over and over, blocking the main javascript thread

_thread_replies.text: any idea why this could be happening?

elements.text: any idea why this could be happening?

_thread_replies.text:
<@U3XBWJ3ND> not yet unfortunately, it's very hard to debug this because all the code involved here is coming from outside our main codebase and is minified and obfuscated.

I jumped on a call with <@U01PE2S4ZL6> and what we do know is that there seems to be an infinite loop of GTM events being triggered. The only thing we know is that these events also seem to be related to iAdvize, our assumption right now is that it's either iAdvize or our GTM setup clashing with iAdvize.

But as i mentioned the last GTM change that i can see was 2 months ago, and I even tried to run the version before that (about 3 months old) and the issue was still happening

elements.text:
not yet unfortunately, it's very hard to debug this because all the code involved here is coming from outside our main codebase and is minified and obfuscated.

I jumped on a call with

and what we do know is that there seems to be an infinite loop of GTM events being triggered. The only thing we know is that these events also seem to be related to iAdvize, our assumption right now is that it's either iAdvize or our GTM setup clashing with iAdvize.

But as i mentioned the last GTM change that i can see was 2 months ago, and I even tried to run the version before that (about 3 months old) and the issue was still happening

_thread_replies.text: In terms of next steps we're going to relay these findings to the iAdvize team in case this new information will help them better debug on their side. But in the meantime I think we're going to have to turn the chatbot off again

elements.text: In terms of next steps we're going to relay these findings to the iAdvize team in case this new information will help them better debug on their side. But in the meantime I think we're going to have to turn the chatbot off again

_thread_replies.text:
also FYI I updated the GTM setup to only trigger iAdvize if the url has `testiadvize` in it (E.g. `<https://www.thepetstable.com/plans-selection?calories=550&isPuppy=true&testiadvize>`)

This way we can still debug this without exposing users to it

)

_thread_replies.text:
yes, but if you want to force it you can open the console and paste this code in:
```dataLayer.push({
        "brand": "petstable",
        "screen": "/whitelabel/plans-selection",
        "squad": "the-pets-table",
        "tribe": "new-ventures-and-ecosystems",
        "system_country": "KN",
        "locale": "en-US",
        "event": "iadvize_chatbot_activate",
        "gtm.uniqueEventId": 239
    })```

*Topic:* `Delivery Date and Cadence`
*Priority:* `Medium priority ðŸŸ¡`
*Description:* `A customer through CC flagged that she keeps getting a box every week even though her cadence is 8 weeks. I looked at her account and her calendar shows her cadence is correct but a new box is being generated each week. Can you take a look at why that is not aligning?`

*Actual behaviour:* `Customer is getting a box every week`

_thread_replies.text:
Hey, these are my findings so far:
According to frontend traces from last 60 days the only interaction user had with CDPS (service responsible for delivery schedule) was changing their delivery day on 13th of October - that's also the only record visible in BOB. CDPS database shows only one entry for that subscription_id, which also shows 8-week cadence starting from W42 (screenshot).

At this point we I feel I need to reach to backend teams to efficiently get down to cause of boxes ending up in SCM export each week

elements.text:
Hey, these are my findings so far:
According to frontend traces from last 60 days the only interaction user had with CDPS (service responsible for delivery schedule) was changing their delivery day on 13th of October - that's also the only record visible in BOB. CDPS database shows only one entry for that subscription_id, which also shows 8-week cadence starting from W42 (screenshot).

At this point we I feel I need to reach to backend teams to efficiently get down to cause of boxes ending up in SCM export each week

_thread_replies.text:
I have reached out to the squad responsible for the delivery schedule
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C047YESJ7GW/p1765450610953189>

elements.text:
Hey Team!
Business stakeholders reported to us that one of the users is receiving box every week, despite their cadence being 8-weeks (confirmed in CDPS, screenshot). Could you please investigate why order for that user gets created every week?

subscription ID:
customer plan ID:

_thread_replies.text: The good news is that staring from W50 (this week) this specific user should receive their boxes every 8 weeks. We have a culprit, I will be digging around to check how user ended up falling in this scenario and try to ensure this is not going to happen in the future

_thread_replies.text: we can refund a box but she is getting good food, I don't think we should refund everything she has received

elements.text: we can refund a box but she is getting good food, I don't think we should refund everything she has received

_thread_replies.text: how many boxes did she receive?

elements.text: how many boxes did she receive?

_thread_replies.text:
She is out of storage space per what she mentioned to the sales manager with food getting spoiled and was charged much more than she had originally planned to pay in quick succession - likely due to the frequency at which she received the boxes.  I don't have BOB access to check how many in total - are you able to check for me? I'll request access as well. Perhaps the last couple of boxes?

In the mean time, I have relayed to him last week to request her to cancel from her end should she choose to and we'll reach out to her once we have a solution like you and I had discussed. He hasn't heard back yet

<@U3XBWJ3ND>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Backend question: how can we pass # of dogs data to CRM?`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Details:* `We'd like to create custom flows for customers who said they have more than 1 dog but have only 1 active subscription. How can we do the following:
1) pass the answer of questions 1? should that be part of the order confirmation event?
2) how can we differentiate between people who have >1 dog and have activated it and people who have >1 dogs but never added additional dogs?`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question
attachments.text:
<@U3XBWJ3ND>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Backend question: how can we pass # of dogs data to CRM?`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Details:* `We'd like to create custom flows for customers who said they have more than 1 dog but have only 1 active subscription. How can we do the following:
1) pass the answer of questions 1? should that be part of the order confirmation event?
2) how can we differentiate between people who have >1 dog and have activated it and people who have >1 dogs but never added additional dogs?`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question

_thread_replies.text:
:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 
To pass the number of dogs data to CRM and create custom flows for customers with multiple dogs but only one active subscription, you can:

1. Pass the answer to question 1 (number of dogs) as part of the order confirmation event:
   - Add a new field called `number_of_dogs` to the `send-order-confirmation` event
   - Include this information when sending the event to SFMC (Salesforce Marketing Cloud)

2. Differentiate between customers with >1 dog and activated vs. not activated:
   - Create a custom field in SFMC to store the `number_of_dogs`
   - Compare this field with the number of active subscriptions
   - Use SFMC's segmentation or automation features to create separate groups:
     * Group 1: `number_of_dogs > 1` AND `active_subscriptions = 1`
     * Group 2: `number_of_dogs > 1` AND `active_subscriptions > 1`

You can then use these groups to create targeted flows and campaigns in SFMC.

For more details, please visit <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04FVDBJZCK/p1681482828157529?thread_ts=1681482828.157529&utm_source=slack-commander|here>
 *Additional sources:*
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C06EH1LF4HW/p1706602072749899?thread_ts=1706602072.749899&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Newsletter Subscription event for Active customers>
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04FVDBJZCK/p1684254319068009?thread_ts=1684254319.068009&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Full address not showing up in order_confirmation event> :warning:_This answer was generated based on the available documentation mentioned above, proceed with caution._

Does this resolve your query, <@U3XBWJ3ND>? Unified Search :mag: button

2. Differentiate between customers with >1 dog and activated vs. not activated:
   - Create a custom field in SFMC to store the `number_of_dogs`
   - Compare this field with the number of active subscriptions

     * Group 1: `number_of_dogs > 1` AND `active_subscriptions = 1`
     * Group 2: `number_of_dogs > 1` AND `active_subscriptions > 1`

You can then use these groups to create targeted flows and campaigns in SFMC.

Hello
Sending this data via order confirmation email should be fairly simple in terms of the backend side

As for differentiating between the different cases, not really sure what Salesforce provide, but in theory this that should be available either by our exports <#C05FQ7E3TBJ|> or the data sync from out kafka topics
